Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Preoperative Educational Classes on Patient Expectations in THA and TKA

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to either the intervention or control group using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients scheduled for THA or TKA at [insert study setting]

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received a standard preoperative class plus a joint-specific module addressing recovery during the first 12 months, while the control group received only the standard class

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess whether preoperative educational classes could alter patients' expectations regarding their 12-month postoperative recovery following total hip arthroplasty (THA) and total knee arthroplasty (TKA)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in expectation scores, measured preoperatively before and after the class using validated hip-specific or knee-specific surveys

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomised to either the intervention or control group using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured

Number_Randomised.evidence: Two randomised controlled trials were conducted, one for THA (177 patients) and one for TKA (143 patients)

Result_Outcome.evidence: In the THA trial, mean changes in expectation scores were +3.3 ± 8 for the intervention group (range, −22 to +32) and +4.9 ± 8 for the control group (range, −13 to +29). In the TKA trial, mean changes were −3.4 ± 10 for the intervention group (range, −26 to +33) and +2.4 ± 10 for the control group (range, −30 to +30)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered under trial number [insert number]
